textos_fuente.text: Crabby Lady Goodland Florida - A Waterfront Seafood Restaurant Skip to main content search Menu Home About Boat Tours Best of Marco Island Private Boat Tour Dolphin Boat Tour Shelling Boat Tour Dolphins and Shelling Sunset Boat Tour 10,000 Islands Eco Boat Tour Family-Friendly Boat Tours Fishing Charters Marco Island FAQ Contact Gift Cards Book Now search Menu Press enter to begin your search Search Close Search Goodland Marco Island Restaurants Crabby Lady Goodland Florida By Florida Island Tours No Comments A Hidden Gem for Seafood Lovers on Marco Island The Crabby Lady in Goodland, Florida, should come to mind when considering Marco Island waterfront dining options. Fresh seafood, laid-back vibes, and a waterfront view put it on Marco’s list of must-go-to spots. Tucked away in Goodland, a stone’s throw from Marco Island’s main attractions, this local favorite serves up delicious food with a side of charm. Why The Crabby Lady Goodland Florida Stands Out Many tourists flock to big-name restaurants on Marco Island, but locals know The Crabby Lady is where the real magic happens. Located off the beaten path, this restaurant delivers a relaxed atmosphere that complements its mouth-watering seafood. Location : Goodland, just 10 minutes from Marco Island. Specialty : Fresh seafood, especially their famous crab dishes. Vibe : Casual, waterfront, and family-friendly. A Local’s Dream Menu When you sit down at The Crabby Lady, you’re immediately greeted with a menu packed with seafood delights. The star of the show is, of course, crab. But don’t stop there—every dish here will make your taste buds dance. Here are some standout dishes: Stone Crab Claws : A must-try during the season. Crabby Lady Special : A delightful mix of crab, shrimp, and scallops. Grouper Sandwich : Perfectly grilled and served with a tangy sauce. Fried Clams : Crispy, golden, and oh-so-good. Lobster Bisque : Rich, creamy, and the perfect start to any meal. No matter what you order, you can expect it to be fresh, flavorful, and made with love. What to Expect During Your Visit to Crabby Lady Goodland Florida Before reviewing each course, let’s set the scene. The Crabby Lady’s location offers stunning waterfront views, so you can dine while watching the sun dip below the horizon. The restaurant is in a modest building that screams “Old Florida,” with plenty of outdoor seating and rustic charm. Outdoor Dining : Dine on the deck with panoramic views of the water. Casual Atmosphere : No need to dress up; come as you are. Live Music : Often featured on weekends, enhancing the laid-back vibe. Now, let’s talk about the food! Starters: Kicking Off Your Seafood Feast Appetizers at The Crabby Lady set the tone for a fantastic meal. Locals often recommend starting with something small but packed with flavor. Conch Fritters : These crispy bites of conch are fried to perfection. Served with a tangy dipping sauce, they’re hard to resist. Oysters Rockefeller : Creamy, cheesy, and baked just right. These oysters are a local favorite. Shrimp Cocktail : Served chilled with a zesty cocktail sauce, the shrimp are fresh and juicy. Insider Tip: The Crabby Catch of the Day Here’s a local secret: Always ask about the Crabby Catch of the Day. The Crabby Lady is all about fresh seafood, and their daily specials often feature something caught just hours before it hits your plate. Whether it’s blackened snapper or grilled mahi-mahi, the catch of the day is always a good bet. Crabby Lady Goodland Florida Entrees: The Main Event While the appetizers are impressive, the main dishes are where The Crabby Lady shines. If you’re a seafood lover, prepare for a feast. Crab-Stuffed Shrimp : Jumbo shrimp stuffed with crabmeat, then baked to perfection. Seafood Platter : This generous mix of crab, shrimp, and scallops is perfect for those who want a bit of everything. Crabby Lady Crab Cakes : Crispy on the outside, tender and flavorful on the inside. These are a must-try. Fried Grouper : Lightly battered and fried until golden brown. Served with fries or coleslaw. Steamed Mussels : Fresh, plump mussels steamed in garlic sauce white wine. Each dish is thoughtfully prepared and bursting with flavor. Whether you’re in the mood for fried, grilled, or baked seafood, The Crabby Lady has you covered. Insider Tip: The Best Time to Visit Locals know heading to The Crabby Lady for an early dinner to avoid crowds. Arriving around 4 PM ensures you snag a prime spot by the water and enjoy a quieter dining experience. Crabby closes early! That’s right, 6 pm. Hey, this is Marco. We eat early, so don’t stay up late here. Drinks: Sip and Savor No seafood meal is complete without the perfect drink. The Crabby Lady offers a full bar featuring everything from cold beers to handcrafted cocktails. Some local favorites include: Crabby Punch : A fruity cocktail with a kick. It’s a local favorite. Frozen Margaritas : Cool and refreshing, perfect for a hot day. Local Craft Beers : The restaurant often features craft beers from nearby breweries such as . Remember to end your meal with a dessert cocktail—perhaps a sweet coconut rum concoction. Dessert: The Sweet Finale The Crabby Lady may be famous for its seafood, but the desserts deserve a mention too. After you’ve indulged in seafood galore, save room for one of their sweet treats. Key Lime Pie : Tart, creamy, and served with a dollop of whipped cream. Coconut Cake : Light, fluffy, and packed with coconut flavor. Brownie Sundae : Rich and chocolatey, perfect for sharing. Insider Tip: Bring Cash Although The Crabby Lady accepts cards, locals suggest bringing cash for a quicker check-out. The restaurant is known for its laid-back atmosphere; sometimes, the card reader can be finicky. Bringing cash ensures a smooth end to your meal. Local Vibe and Atmosphere Part of what makes The Crabby Lady so special is the atmosphere. This isn’t a touristy spot with overpriced food and fancy decor. It’s a down-to-earth place where locals gather to unwind after a long day. The staff is friendly, the vibe is relaxed, and there’s always a sense of community. You might talk with a local fisherman at the neighboring table, or watch pelicans dive for fish right from your seat. It’s all part of the charm. Local Events and Entertainment One of the best things about The Crabby Lady is that it’s more than just a restaurant. It’s also a hub for local events and live music. On weekends, you can catch local bands playing everything from rock to country, adding to the already fun atmosphere. Live Music : Typically featuring local bands on weekends, from 3 to 6 pm. Sunday Funday: Music starts earlier, and the outdoor BBQ is smoking up some delicious hog, burgers, or even alligator. Holiday Specials : The Crabby Lady often hosts themed events around major holidays. Captain’s Tip: Dock Your Boat at Crabby Lady Goodland Florida For those arriving by water, The Crabby Lady has a dock for customers. It’s the perfect spot to sail in, grab a bite, and enjoy the laid-back atmosphere before returning to the water. They also have a dockmaster to help you tie up your vessel. What Locals Are Saying About Crabby Lady Goodland Florida Locals rave about The Crabby Lady, and it’s easy to see why. Here’s a quick roundup of what people are saying: “Best seafood on the island.” “Perfect spot for a casual family dinner.” “The crab cakes are to die for!” “Great live music and a fun atmosphere.” Whether you’re a local or a visitor, The Crabby Lady promises a meal to remember. Local’s Tip: Don’t Leave Without the Crab Balls Here’s something that’ll surprise even the most seasoned Marco Island traveler. The Crabby Lady offers a unique crab item on the menu. Joe’s Crab Balls are not only delicious but fun to order. When asking for Joe’s Crab Balls at the Crabby Lady, keep a straight face! Peel-and-eat shrimp are also a favorite appetizer. Unlike shrimp, which is sold by the pound or half-pound, Joe’s Crab Balls are always sold by the pair. Why The Crabby Lady Goodland Florida is a Must-Visit When it comes to finding the perfect mix of delicious seafood, local charm, and unbeatable waterfront views, The Crabby Lady stands out as a must-visit on Marco Island. Whether you’re looking for a casual meal after a day at the beach or a fun evening with live music, this spot offers something for everyone. Remember to: Try the crab dishes—they’re legendary. Sit in the “backyard” on the picnic tables for live music and a waterfront view of the boats. Bring cash for a hassle-free experience. Ask about the catch of the day or secret menu items. Add The Crabby Lady to your itinerary next time you visit. You won’t regret it!
